content.description: Start just like Easy Street then traverse left along the bottom of the boulder using mostly toes to make it to the other side. Once you make it to the opposite edge from the start, top out to the right of the block at the top of the boulder.
content.location: Boulder is hard to miss from the LT. It is the tallest boulder in the main field. Problem is on the opposite side from the trail.

content.description: This is a really cool traversing boulder problem. Start low and on theft then move up and over across to the right following a rail system.
content.location: as you approach the main boulder field from the LT, you will see a large wall split into two horizontal shelves behind the field. The problem is across the bottom shelf behind the boulder field.

content.description: This is a consistently fist sized (right leaning) crack that can be climbed a number of ways. The crux in my opinion is about 1/3 the way up. Rock is very sharp. If your setting up a TR, directional pro is recommended to protect from the swing.
content.protection: 2.5"- 4"  there are 3 sets of bolted anchors at the top of this wall for TR set ups and future sport routs.
content.location: Crack can be seen from the long trail. If you are looking at the main boulder field from the long trail. Walk around behind the boulder field to the left.

content.protection: this climb does take good gear tho it is barely tall enough to warrant any.. theres a tree at the top for anchors if desired.
content.location: from the hog back road follow the long trail until you come to the main boulder field. When the LT makes a sharp turn left follow the trail that goes right. follow that trail for about 100 yds as it circles its way back around the Butchers Island. The wall and climb will be on your left directly off the trail.

content.description: work your way up the feature in the middle of the slab.
Start at the base of a crack that starts mossy but opens into a chimney/off width and back into a fist crack before reaching a two bolt anchor at the top. fun varied moves.
content.protection: Bigger is better! 2"-6". Bolts will be added for sport climbing in the future. Bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: Following the LT from the HB road. continue along the trail until you can see the corner of the main wall to your right. from the corner the climb is located about 20' to the right.

content.description: This is a fun climb. work your way up the tallest part of the wall.
content.protection: Bolted anchor has been installed on 7/22.
content.location: from the hogback road follow the LT past the main boulder field and climbing wall unit you come to the top of the hill. at the crest of the hill there is a trail that breaks right along a ridge. follow that trail for about 100 yds. the top of the bacon slab wall will be on your left.

content.description: Climb up ledges with a general crack trending slightly right. Lots of good feet with some ledges on the way up. resist the urge to escape out onto the dirty ledge halfway up. Continue up to the tree on the right. Hoping to get a bolted anchor in for the top of this one. For now, there is a rope anchor on the tree.
content.protection: very light rack, took cams from .5 up to a 3. Tree anchor
content.location: walk right of the boulder field, very prominent crack going straight up, slightly scrubbed.

content.description: Laydown start with a good foot underneath and a heel hook. work your way up and over the face using crimps more heel hooks to top out over the tallest part of the boulder.
content.location: Directly between the LT and main boulder field. On the right side of the field as your looking at it from the trail.

content.description: A fun climb with sustained movement. As with the rest of the area the rock is sharp. Crux is in the lower sections of the climb.
content.protection: There are  bolts  on the bottom a couple of pieces of gear   and a final  bolt
content.location: Located in the main climbing zone on the wall nicknamed the breakfast wall. tucked behind the main boulder field.

content.description: Start at the bottom of a crack and underneath a chimney to the left of corner of the main climbing wall. work your way up the chimney to the shelf then stem your way up to the bolted anchor after you pull the top.
content.protection: A few small cams and a nut are helpful. there are also 3 bolts on the route to protect the thin areas. Bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: Following the LT from the hog back road. Follow the LT past the main boulder field until the trail crosses a small street bed and makes a turn right bak up the hill. The main wall and climb are visible from the LT.

content.description: Don't Believe it don't believe everything you read online. the small face looks like somebody had tried to scrub it and maybe do a couple of Boulder problems on it and it looks like a large green egg. A lot of moss has been removed revealing probably 6 Short Boulder problems mostly v easy and potentially one 40 foot Traverse Boulder problem with some somewhat High moves potentially in the V2 range. It's not completely clean yet.
content.protection: basically a boulder problem but I top roped it off a tree to scrub it and work on the Traverse because it's higher than I prefer.
content.location: Coming from Route 15 on the Long Trail it's just over the height of land before you descend towards the breakfast wall of butchers Island. But it's almost behind you is you're coming down the hill. If you approach from the Hogback Road beware of poison ivy just after the bridge. It will be right in your face before the crest of the Hill after passing the breakfast wall.

content.description: This a great super mellow warm up that cruises the ramp like side of a fin. Start at the very point working your way up the edge to the top.
content.location: Highly visible as you approach the main boulder field from the LT.

content.description: A fun problem that works its cup the same edge as Easy Street but on the other side.
content.location: Boulder is hard to miss from the LT. It is the tallest boulder in the main field.

content.description: start 20' to the left of Spaghetti and Highballs. work your way up and right on small hold to gain a left rising crack. follow the crack to the top and go straight up from there.
This is a fun little crack with okay pro. The log at the bottom has been removed.
content.location: Far right side of the bacon slab.

content.description: The left hand bolted anchor on the breakfast wall. I started up   the wet offwidth  with for about 30 feet and then climbed up the main wall .you can also start at the bottom of the other route and diagonal to the left. The rock quality is extremely suspect hence the name and probably not worth bolting.
content.location: Left end  of the breakfast   wall

content.description: work your way up the face on small crimps avoiding the left edge of the boulder to keep it a challenge. top out over the highest point of the boulder.
content.location: In the main boulder field between the field and the LT.

content.description: Very shady/short hill with varied fun climbing. there are small walls and boulder problems all the way around the hill that makes up Butchers Island. W.I.P.
